column4: there's all this neat stuff in nautilus that's too hidden.  Like, who's going to figure out that you have to open your home directory and click "Places -> CD Creator" to burn a CD?
i find that nautilus is pretty cool that if i right click on an ISO and i can burn the image to disk

sure, it's useful, it's good functionality.  What I'm saying is that someone new to GNOME is going to scan through the applications menu for a cd burning app, not see one, and assume there isn't such functionality.
